messages: 59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:39): what's the difference between a field and a property, in xbl?
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (11:40): 59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc: planet was caching xhtml here today
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (11:41): 59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc: a field is basically an expando property with a default value, a property is a getter and optionally a setter
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (11:46): and the field initialization happens when the binding is loaded, right?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (11:48): that sounds familiar
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (11:58): 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57: it used to, but now it happens when the field is first read (assuming it isn't written to first, I guess)
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (11:58): ah, didn't know that changed
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:01): b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd, that code you just reviewed, I couldn't actually work out what |pref| was
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:02): you're probably right though
b92af08a18aff623222629da14873ffd (12:05): 59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc: probably this one: http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/suite/common/contentAreaClick.js#48
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:06): no wonder I never found it
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:17): actually, anybody: ping?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:18): is there any way to mark a xul element as irrelevant to a11y?

27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:29): hm, nsIAccessibleProvider.NoAccesible?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:29): oh, duh
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:30): I'm starting to think I'm the blind one
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:30): nsAccessible.cpp might have other ways
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:31): I set the tooltiptext from the javascript, is that what you had in mind?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:31): extensions.js, I mean
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:31): right
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:31): I'll 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57e up another try build
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:31): oh, i did it from the base binding constructor
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:32): well extensions.js already handles the description text, so I just put it in there
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:33): grumbles about the original design
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:33): iirc, xbl:inherits only orks on anonymous nodes, not the root of the binding :\
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:35): hm, i worry about ever re-using that outside of the addons manager, and having non-obvious dependencies like that :\
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:36): the way we hacked on the description is not ideal
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:37): you mean tooltiptext? or the actual displayed description?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:37): the displayed one
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:37): I don't fancy fixing xul grid to 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57e it work though
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:37): how so? (remember, i didn't review that)
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:39): oh yeah
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:39): we add another row to the grid to stop the vertical alignment being rubbish
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:45): ugly, eh?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:45): (and speaking of non-obvious dependencies)
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:46): how did the vertical alignment break without that?
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:47): the left column gets taller, and the controls don't line up with the label any more
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:48): which is ugly and boriss told me off
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:48): iirc
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:49): woah
59e570bef8ead953686ff65207d2dfbc (12:49): late night ircing?
0877d1e2aefd92d77be920252c0f6259 (12:49): not as good as late night icing
27a00904c55e1a3947176eabe2c0f262 (12:50): now i want cake icing...

a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:03): 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57, on bug 721603, why do you think we should have an if?
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:03): I was going to add an assert
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:03): but the very next line has a dereference
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (13:03): a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80: an assert doesn't protect from crashes
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:03): so the assert would do the same thing
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:03): well, it is a crash
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (13:04): the if was for opt builds
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:04): yes, so the only thing an assert would do is move the crash one line earlier on debug
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:04): what is the valid case for os being null?
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (13:04): something unexpected for sure
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:04): that would just 9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57e the problem harder to find
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (13:05): well, we usually check it, so would be consistent. probably both ways is something that can hardly happen
9c3280cc9557712aa6900443e4b92e57 (13:06): so we catch in in debug, eventually don't crash in opt
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:06): better than just "if" if you want a compromise
a604f231696173b88fa8c6214a3b7c80 (13:07): I find it a strange pattern since for it the be correct everything that is expecting the massage has to handle it never being sent...
43e21db98679a107d20efc688dfaa927 (13:07): well that message is not extremely important
43e21db98679a107d20efc688dfaa927 (13:07): we use it for testing purposes
